text: Christian Ingemann Petersen (born 9 December 1873 - 25 January 1963) was a Danish track cyclist. He won the silver medal at the 1895 ICA Track Cycling World Championships, in the men's amateur sprint event behind Jaap Eden. Ingemann became five times Danish national champion in several disciplines in the 1890s. In the sprint (1895 and 1896) standing race with tandem pacemaker (1890, 1895) and Danish mile (1889). Ingemann became a professional cyclist in 1897. == References == Category:1873 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Danish cyclists
title: Christian Ingemann Petersen
